intro: Cryptophoranthus oblongifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cryptophoranthus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forests or wetlands, and has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces seeds that are dispersed by wind. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
